Burma:
The Pagan Empire acknowledges suzerainty of the Mongol Empire
Wareru declares independence and founds Kingdom of Ramanya
King Narathihapate is assassinated
China: The Zhongdu-born Rabban Bar Sauma left for Europe as an ambassador of Arghun, the khan of the Ilkhanate. Battle of Pagan: Yuan forces captured the Pagan capital Bagan.
England: Rhys ap Maredudd led a revolt against English rule in Wales.
Spain: Alfonso the Liberal conquered Menorca and annexed it to the Kingdom of Majorca, dissolving its autonomous government. Battle of the Counts: A Sicilian-Aragonese fleet defeated a superior Angevin force at Naples, breaking the latter's attempted invasion of Sicily. The Union of Aragon, a political organization of nobles and townspeople in Aragon, won the Privilege of the Union, a devolution of many royal powers to the Aragonese nobility, from Alfonso the Liberal.
Vietnam: Mongol invasions of Vietnam: The Mongol navy was destroyed, forcing the army, left without provisions, to begin its retreat from Đại Việt.
